critique: This document pertains to an amendment to the Civil Service Rules regarding administrative or custodial positions within the United States Housing Authority. It allows for the filling of certain positions without open competitive examination if the Civil Service Commission deems it necessary for the best interests of the service. This could be seen as a slight expansion of executive power, as it provides more flexibility in hiring practices. It also leans towards federal control, as it deals with federal housing projects. There isn't a strong indication of ideological tilt, immigration approach, national security vs. civil liberties, economic regulation, or social inclusion. Therefore, most of these axes will be scored as neutral.
